step_feedback.feedback: Good job on the first step!  You performed the shoulder blade squeeze and circular motion. Remember to inhale deeply as you pull your shoulders back to maximize rib expansion and oxygen flow.
In step 2, focus on maintaining a smoother, more controlled circular motion. The data suggests some inconsistencies in the movement. Try to keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid jerky movements.

Step 3 shows some improvement, but maintaining a consistent, controlled circular motion throughout the four repetitions is key.  Ensure you are completing the full range of motion while keeping your movements smooth and controlled.  Try to minimize any unnecessary wrist movement.

exercise_summary: The patient demonstrated a good understanding of the Shoulder Roll exercise. While the initial shoulder blade squeeze was performed well, maintaining a consistent and controlled circular motion throughout all four repetitions needs improvement.  Focus on smooth, controlled movements and deep inhalations to enhance the exercise's benefits.
